description: The hooch tragedy in Bihar's Siwan and Saran districts has claimed 35 lives, with recent deaths also reported in Gopalganj. Authorities have launched extensive raids, seizing large quantities of illicit liquor and arresting 15 people. The district administrations confirmed the fatalities and ongoing efforts to combat the liquor mafia in the region.
title: Bihar hooch tragedy toll hits 35; 15 held

description: PM Narendra Modi will visit Russia on Oct 22-23 to attend the 16th Brics Summit in Kazan at Putin's invitation. The summit, themed 'Strengthening Multilateralism for Just Global Development and Security,' will address key global issues like the Gaza conflict. Bilateral meetings with Brics leaders are planned, pending confirmation of a meeting with Xi Jinping.
title: PM Modi to attend Brics meet in Russia, West Asia to top agenda

description: A private school in Jiribam, Manipur, was set ablaze amid rising tensions, days after NDA legislators held peace talks in Delhi. Authorities suggest internal school disputes as the cause. The Hmar tribe blames Meitei militant outfits; investigations are ongoing.
title: Leading school in Manipur set afire amid unrest

description: The Supreme Court recalled its August 2022 judgment that struck down key provisions of the Prohibition of Benami Property Transactions Act, 1988, after the Union government argued that the court had ruled on the provisions' validity without any party challenging them. The appeal against the HC order was restored.
title: Supreme Court nixes its verdict quashing parts of benami property law

description: Congress is pressing for three seats in the Uttar Pradesh bypolls, despite ally Samajwadi Party (SP) initially granting two. Congress is likely to contest in Ghaziabad and Khair, with Kundarki also under negotiation. An announcement is expected soon.
title: Congress seeks 3rd seat in UP after SP's offer of 2
Congress MP seeks House oversight of intelligence agencies

description: Shiv Sena (UBT) has urged the Election Commission to investigate the Mahayuti for allegedly violating the Model Code of Conduct by issuing 359 government resolutions and appointing over 50 supporters to state-run corporations on the day the MCC was announced. They seek nullification and stringent action.
title: UBT alleges MCC violation, files plaint with EC

description: Assam Sanmilita Mahasangha is seeking legal advice to appeal the SC's 4:1 verdict that upheld Section 6A of the Citizenship Act. The organization claims the ruling is biased and unconstitutional, arguing the base year for identifying foreigners should be 1951, not 1971.
title: Assam body may appeal SC's 6A ruling before 9-judge bench

description: J&K Chief Minister Omar Abdullah's first cabinet meeting approved a resolution for statehood restoration but ignored reviving Article 370, sparking accusations of collusion with BJP. Critics argue the focus on statehood alone betrays promises made to restore special status before recent elections.
title: Omar cabinet clears resolution for statehood restoration, mum on 370

description: The Canadian government has been tracking Indian journalists' social media posts, alleging foreign interference following PM Trudeau's statement on Hardeep Nijjar’s killing. The dossier, presented by Canada's rapid response mechanism, scrutinizes narratives from Indian media portraying Trudeau and Canadian institutions negatively, suggesting a significant diplomatic impact on Canadian foreign policy and national security.
title: Canada profiles Indian journos, submits report to foreign interference inquiry

description: The US Department of Justice has indicted former RAW operative Vikash Yadav for allegedly plotting to assassinate pro-Khalistan extremist Gurpatwant Singh Pannun. Partnering with accused narcotics trafficker Nikhil Gupta, Yadav reportedly offered $100,000 to a DEA undercover agent posing as a hitman. This case highlights increasing transnational repression targeting diaspora communities in the US.
title: Yadav's indictment US signal to China, Russia

description: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) arrested Bihar IAS officer Sanjeev Hans and former RJD MLA Gulab Yadav in a money laundering case, seizing over Rs 80 lakh in unaccounted cash, along with significant quantities of gold and silver bullion. Raids were conducted in Delhi, Mumbai, and Kolkata.
title: IAS officer, RJD ex-MLA arrested in Bihar in laundering case

description: Two members of a family in Sakti, Chhattisgarh, were found dead and four others in critical condition following a weeklong 'tantric ritual.' Neighbours alerted police after hearing faint chants. An autopsy revealed traces of poison, suggesting possible murder amid prolonged fasting and ritualistic practices.
title: 2 brothers dead, 4 kin critical after weeklong 'tantric ritual' at home in C'garh village

description: Haryana Congress is awaiting a decision on its next legislature party chief, with the final decision pending a report from three observers. Despite criticism of former CM Bhupinder Singh Hooda, he still retains the support of the majority of the MLAs.
title: Congress observers meet Haryana MLAs over CLP head selection

description: Chief Minister Nayab Singh Saini announced free dialysis for chronic kidney patients in Haryana's government hospitals, fulfilling a key BJP election promise. The cabinet will implement the Supreme Court's decision on sub-classifications within Scheduled Castes for reservations and reaffirmed support for farmers, including subsidies to prevent stubble burning.
title: On 1st day, CM Saini fulfils 1st promise: Free dialysis to chronic kidney patients

description: Tamil Nadu CM M K Stalin criticised Governor R N Ravi for omitting the word 'Dravida' from the 'Tamil Thai Vaazhthu,' stating it insulted Tamil unity. Political leaders including AIADMK's Edappadi K Palaniswami expressed similar concerns. Governor Ravi defended himself against the accusation, while DD Tamil apologized for the unintentional error.
title: Tamil Nadu governor hits back at CM for 'racist' remark & 'false claims'

description: In Maharashtra, seat-sharing talks among MVA allies face friction; Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut criticises Congress leaders for indecisiveness, pushing for quicker decisions locally. MPCC chief Nana Patole defers to the Congress high command, while Uddhav Thackeray emphasizes the need to avoid breaking points and anticipates resolving the issue soon.
title: Raut, Patole clash over seats. Don't go to extreme: Uddhav Thackeray

description: All major parties—Shiv Sena, Sena (UBT), BJP, and MNS—are vying for Shivaji Park for rallies on Nov 17 ahead of the assembly elections. The BMC received applications from all four, with MNS claiming priority. The state urban development department and Election Commission will decide the venue allocation.
title: All roads lead to Shivaji Park: 4 parties want it for November 17 rally

description: Opposition in Jammu and Kashmir criticized Omar Abdullah's government for emphasizing statehood restoration while being silent on Kashmir's special status. They accused him of aligning with BJP and deviating from promises made during elections. Critics insist on addressing Article 370 and holding the resolution in the assembly.
title: Omar Abdullah comes under opposition fire for silence on 370 restoration

description: Punjab Police have uncovered the murder plot of Sikh activist Gurpreet Singh with the arrest of three associates of gangster-turned-terrorist Arsh Dalla. The investigation, linking Waris Punjab De chief Amritpal Singh, found he orchestrated the crime. Gurpreet was killed on Oct 9, and authorities are now hunting for more suspects involved.
title: Gurpreet Singh murder: Punjab Police crack case, arrest 3

description: The Supreme Court reversed its 2022 decision on striking down sections of the Benami Properties Act, following the Centre's argument that there was no constitutional challenge to the provisions. The court recognized the mistake and allowed the government to file review petitions. The act aims to curb shell company activities and facilitate property attachment held benami.
title: Govt can file pleas against HC orders post-2022 benami law ruling: SC

description: Salim Khan insists his son, Salman Khan, shouldn't apologize for the blackbuck incident as he claims Salman never harmed any animal. He views recent threats as extortion attempts. In light of his friend Baba Siddique's murder, Salman now films under heavy security, requiring Aadhaar cards for access to his sets.
title: Salman Khan has no reason to apologise: Salim Khan to Bishnoi Community

description: Royal experts are also aware that Harry and Meghan are buying a house in Portugal and they believe that King Charles' message to them would be of indifference. King Charles is not going to "concern himself" with the news, experts claimed. King Charles evicted them from their Windsor property after they left the family and defamed the family in the public but the King will not be perturbed by the news.
title: Are Meghan and Harry buying a house in Portugal? King Charles has a message

description: Uttar Pradesh recorded the highest road accident fatalities last year, while Tamil Nadu saw the most injuries. Nearly 44% of deaths involved two-wheeler riders, with 70% not wearing helmets. Experts suggest proactive steps including mandatory separate lanes for two-wheelers on highways and enhanced accountability in traffic management.
title: UP tops road accident deaths in 2023, Maha & TN next on list

description: Canadian Foreign Minister Mélanie Joly warned India's diplomats of risking Canadian lives following their expulsion over alleged links to the assassination of a Sikh activist. Prime Minister Trudeau and police claim Indian officials provided information leading to violent acts on Canadian soil.
title: Canada warns Indian diplomats after expulsion of high commissioner over Sikh activist’s killing

description: Ronika Stone, standout volleyball player, shared her wedding preparations on Instagram, including a dress hunt with her sister in Manhattan's Kleinfeld. Stone's fiancé, NFL QB Jordan Love, recently made headlines with a four-touchdown game. Their mutual admiration is evident through heartfelt posts, celebrating their journey toward marriage, set for June 2024.
title: Fiancée Ronika Stone hints at wedding plans with Jordan Love as she turns 'Bride' before Packers vs. Texans on SNF

description: In Chhattisgarh's Sakti district, two brothers were found dead and four family members were hospitalized after prolonged fasting and chanting rituals. Neighbors alerted police when the chants weakened, leading to the discovery of potential poisoning. Authorities investigate the family's mental state and involvement with a Godman.
title: Two men die, family members hospitalized after prolonged ‘sadhna’ in Chhattisgarh

description: A suburban train derailed at Kalyan station in Thane district near Mumbai around 9.00 pm Friday, disrupting mainline services. The Titwala-CSMT train's rear coach went off track as it entered platform number 2, but no injuries were reported. Another derailment had occurred days earlier at Mumbai Central, affecting several suburban trains.
title: Suburban train derails at Maharashtra's Kalyan station, no injuries reported

description: ​Donald Trump is 6 feet 3 inches tall, according to records. His weight is 244 pounds (110 kg). He is medically obese. However, there are many records of Trump's height and weight. He self-reported his weight as 215 pounds (97.5 kg) in 2020. Another record from 2018 said his weight was 239 pounds (108 kg).
title: 'Overweight...never smoker': 5 things to know about Donald Trump's health

description: Following the death of NCP leader Baba Siddique, his son Zeeshan Siddique posted a cryptic message on X. Zeeshan, a Congress MLA, met with Maharashtra's deputy chief minister Devendra Fadnavis, who updated him on the police investigation into the murder. Nine arrests have been made, with significant progress reported in the case.
title: 'Not all that is hidden ...': Zeeshan Siddique's cryptic post days after father's death

description: Kamala Harris' campaign highlights her energy and criticizes 78-year-old Donald Trump, who is reportedly canceling interviews due to exhaustion. Trump's team denies the claims, asserting his strong work ethic. Both candidates shift towards podcasts, moving away from traditional media engagements.
title: Tired Trump gets trolled by Team Harris as campaign reaches final fortnight

description: India ranks second globally in adopting Generative AI platforms, excelling in content editing and educational tools. The country accounts for 12% of global AI usage in content editing and is third in productivity tools. While personal assistant apps lag, there’s potential for growth with localized solutions and better monetization strategies.
title: India ranks second globally in generative AI adoption: Report

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin reiterated PM Modi's view that BRICS is 'non-West,' not 'anti-West,' ahead of the 16th BRICS Summit. Putin confirmed BRICS's openness to new members and highlighted economic benefits for non-members. He also addressed Russia's conflict with Ukraine and Moscow's stance on Ukrainian nuclear weapons acquisition.
title: 'Not anti-western but ...': Putin borrows PM Modi's words to describe Brics

description: Doctors in West Bengal threaten a statewide strike on October 22, demanding justice for a deceased colleague allegedly raped and murdered in August. They seek immediate action from Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, with potential for a nationwide strike if demands, including removal of Health Secretary N S Nigam and improved hospital facilities, are unmet.
title: 'If CM does not act ...': Agitating doctors' ultimatum to Bengal govt in RG Kar case

description: Public works department issues a demolition notice to Abdul Hameed for an illegal house construction, located too close to the road, demanding removal within three days. Hameed, involved in Bahraich violence and arrested for killing Ram Gopal Mishra, faces action as per the Road Control Act 1964.
title: Bahraich violence: Demolition notice pasted on house of main accused

description: Karnataka introduces a new fee on transactions via platforms like Zomato, Swiggy, and Uber to fund gig workers' social security. The 1-2% welfare fee, added to consumer costs, aims to support gig workers with collected funds managed by a dedicated welfare board. The bill reaches the state assembly in December.
title: K'taka govt imposes transaction fee on Zomato, Swiggy, others

description: Netflix's Q3 2024 results show significant growth, adding 5 million subscribers, driven by a crackdown on password sharing and the ad-supported tier. Revenue reached $9.83 billion, with strong growth in EMEA and Asia-Pacific. Challenges remain due to past Hollywood strikes, but live content is expanding.
title: How Netflix’s ban on password sharing and ad push has worked big time

description: Salman Khan’s father and veteran screenwriter Salim Khan has firmly dismissed any connection between the killing of NCP leader Baba Siddique and the Bollywood superstar. In an interview with ABP News, Salim Khan shared the family's perspective on the heightened security concerns surrounding Salman, addressing the implications of Siddique’s recent assassination.
title: Salim Khan dismisses links between Salman Khan and Baba Siddique's murder

description: Karwa Chauth Wishes and Messages: Karwa Chauth, a Hindu festival observed by married women for their husbands' long lives, focuses on fasting from sunrise to moonrise. This year's festival falls on October 20 with the Puja Muhurat from 5:46 PM to 7:02 PM. Celebrating with devotion, women break their fast by viewing the moon and their husbands.
title: Karwa Chauth 2024: Top 50 wishes, messages, and quotes to share

description: India becomes the first team in Test cricket history to hit 100 sixes in a calendar year, surpassing England's 2022 record. Leading contributors are Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shubman Gill. Amidst trailing by 356 runs, India fights back, closing Day 3 at 231 for three against New Zealand.
title: Historic first in 147 years! Team India shatters Test record
US opens RAW wounds with murder-for-hire charges against Indian operative

description: The Pakistan Cricket Board has proposed a plan for the Indian cricket team to travel back to India between matches during the 2025 ICC Champions Trophy. This aims to address security concerns and ensure India's participation. The decision rests with the Indian government, and ongoing discussions focus on logistics and security.
title: BCCI gets unique proposal from PCB for CT 2025

description: AAP leader Satyendra Jain was released from Tihar Jail after being granted bail in a money laundering case. Jain's arrest by the ED was based on allegations linked to a 2017 CBI FIR. His release was celebrated by AAP members, who claim the case against him was a BJP conspiracy.
title: 'Atishi will also have to go to jail': AAP's Satyendar Jain takes swipe at BJP after walking out of Tihar

description: Microsoft reported a two-week loss of security logs for key cloud products due to a bug in an internal monitoring agent, affecting Entra, Sentinel, Defender for Cloud, and Purview. This may impact customers' ability to detect security threats between September 2 and 19, 2024.
title: Microsoft confirms data loss for Cloud customers due to bug
Bullet-riddled body of non-local man recovered in J&K's Shopian

description: Bollywood actor Salman Khan has resumed filming Bigg Boss 18 under strict security due to death threats from the Lawrence Bishnoi gang. Security measures include heavy guard presence and Aadhaar verification for access. Despite the threats, production progresses with planned episodes.
title: Salman continues Bigg Boss 18 shoot amid Bishnoi threats; 60 guards on high alert

description: Chennai Super Kings have decided their primary retentions for the upcoming IPL season, including MS Dhoni. Financial arrangements could see Gaikwad and Jadeja receiving equal pay. Final purse decisions for Dube and Pathirana remain to be concluded.
title: IPL: CSK's Ruturaj, Jadeja may get similar pays

description: Rishabh Pant, recovering from a knee blow, took throwdowns during the Tea break on Day 3, fueling hopes for India's second innings against New Zealand. Despite Dhruv Jurel covering as wicketkeeper, Pant is expected to bat without a penalty time, aiming to replicate his past memorable Test performances. India conceded a 356-run lead in the first innings to New Zealand after getting bowled out for 46, their lowest Test total at home.
title: Good news for India! Rishabh Pant starts batting practice

description: During the third day of the India-New Zealand Test in Bengaluru, former Indian coach Ravi Shastri humorously commented on a fan hiding his ice cream when spotted on the stadium's big screen. Shastri's witty remark about the 'Ice Cream boy' quickly resonated with fans, generating mixed reactions on social media.
title: Watch: Ice Cream Boy! Shastri roasts spectator on-air in his inimitable style

description: The National Testing Agency (NTA) has announced a significant change in the JEE Main 2025 exam pattern, reverting to its pre-pandemic format. From 2025, Section B will include only five mandatory numerical questions across each subject. This change, expected to lower cutoffs, emphasizes the importance of a comprehensive study approach, as all chapters in Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics will now hold equal weight.
title: JEE Main 2025 exam pattern change may lead to reduced cutoff, says expert

description: India has dispatched 33 tons of essential medical supplies to Lebanon, beginning with an initial shipment of 11 tons. These supplies include medications for cardiovascular diseases, NSAIDs, anti-inflammatory agents, antibiotics, and anesthetics. Additional consignments will follow soon to aid Lebanon's healthcare sector. This gesture underscores India's commitment to providing timely humanitarian assistance.
title: India begins op to send 33 tons of humanitarian aid to Lebanon

description: The Kansas City Chiefs, despite their 5-0 start, are considering a trade for a wide receiver, as injuries have depleted their receiving corps. Insider Nate Taylor suggests the team will look for young talent, with Carolina Panthers' Diontae Johnson named as a potential target.
title: Kansas City Chiefs insider Nate Taylor says Chiefs 'probably going to...'

description: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin urged PM Modi to reconsider holding Hindi-centric events in non-Hindi states, citing potential regional strain. Stalin suggested celebrating local languages equally and proposed events to honor all classical languages, aiming to promote unity and recognition of India's linguistic diversity.
title: 'No national language': Stalin writes to PM Modi over Hindi month event

description: Virat Kohli achieved his first half-century of the year in the second innings of the first Test against New Zealand, becoming the fourth Indian batter to surpass 9,000 Test runs. He took 197 innings to reach this milestone, the longest among the Indian legends.
title: Kohli joins Tendulkar, Dravid, Gavaskar in this elite list

description: Delhi's Rouse Avenue Court has granted bail to former AAP minister Satyendar Jain, who faced charges of money laundering through shell companies. Arrested by the Enforcement Directorate in May 2022, Jain argued he was not a flight risk and sought bail on health grounds.
title: After 2 yrs in jail, AAP's Satyendar gets bail in money laundering case

description: Supreme Court granted bail to MLA Abbas Ansari in a money laundering case. A bench of Justices M M Sundresh and Pankaj Mithal provided the relief. Earlier, the Allahabad high court had denied bail citing evidence linking Ansari to illicit activities. The ED had filed the case, and Ansari has been in custody since November 2022.
title: Money laundering case: SC grants bail to Mukhtar Ansari's son Abbas

description: UAE has expanded its visa on arrival (VoA) eligibility for more Indian travelers. Now, those with valid UK and EU visas can also avail this facility, in addition to those holding US visas or residence permits. The VoA can be obtained for up to 60 days.
title: Indians holding UK, Schengen visas eligible for visa on arrival in UAE

description: India's second innings in the first Test against New Zealand saw half-centuries from Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma, and Sarfaraz Khan, ending the day at 231 for three. Kohli's dismissal off the last ball left India trailing by 125 runs. New Zealand's Rachin Ravindra scored his second Test century, contributing to their first innings total of 402.
title: 1st Test: Virat, Sarfaraz score fifties as India fight back vs NZ

description: New Zealand finishes Day 3 of the first Test against India on a high note by dismissing Virat Kohli right before stumps, leaving India at 231 for three. Rachin Ravindra's century and his pivotal partnership with Tim Southee had earlier helped New Zealand post a formidable total of 402.
title: 'Virat Kohli punished us': Rachin Ravindra's huge comment

description: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar raised concerns over human rights violations against Hindus in neighboring countries and criticised global silence on the issue. He condemned certain forces for portraying India negatively and highlighted the importance of safeguarding minorities in the country. Dhankhar also warned against using human rights as a foreign policy tool and emphasised India’s efforts in providing free rations during the pandemic.
title: Dhankhar's sharp attack over 'global silence' on violence against Hindus

description: At a Catholic charity dinner in New York known for bipartisan humor, Donald Trump and Kamala Harris traded barbs. Trump, known for his crude insults, aimed jests at Harris, her husband, and current politicians, while Harris responded via video. The event featured moments of rare camaraderie amid an election campaign filled with bitterness.
title: An evening of humor in US in a season of electoral rancor

description: In a significant development, Mumbai police have arrested five more individuals linked to the murder of NCP leader Baba Siddique, raising the total arrests to nine. The suspects were apprehended in targeted raids in Raigad district and are believed to have ties to the Lawrence Bishnoi gang. The investigation, which remains ongoing, aims to fully uncover the conspiracy behind Siddique's assassination.
title: Baba Siddique murder: Five more accused arrested after CBI raids

description: Revelations about an underground jail in Bangladesh highlight the brutal methods used during Sheikh Hasina's regime. Critics were abducted, tortured, and often killed, with survivors held in the secretive 'Aynaghor.' Families of the disappeared continue to seek answers and justice for their lost loved ones.
title: 'Humiliation & pain': Chilling accounts from inmates once lodged in Hasina's jail

description: Meta has fired about two dozen employees for misusing $25 daily meal credits meant for late-night work, causing mixed reactions among staff. Some employees were found to have used the credits for non-food items. While some workers believe this move was harsh, others feel it is justified for violating clear company policies.
title: Facebook firing staff over $25 meal credit misuse leaves employees divided

description: Dive into the top five entertainment stories of the day, where we bring you the latest buzz straight from the world of movies, celebrities, and pop culture. From Salman Khan's ex-girlfriend Somy Ali talking about approaching gangster Lawrence Bishnoi to Akash Ambani refusing cake from birthday girl Radhika Merchant; here's taking a look at top FIVE news from the world of entertainment today!
title: Salman's ex-girlfriend Somy Ali on approaching Bishnoi and other entertainment news

description: The National Medical Commission's revised Competency-Based Medical Education curriculum has drawn sharp criticism from disability rights and transgender advocates due to its failure to include essential provisions from the Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act, 2016, and the Transgender Persons (Protection of Rights) Act, 2019. The Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment has intervened, urging the NMC to reassess the curriculum. International organisations have threatened to escalate the issue to the World Federation for Medical Education.
title: Why did NMC's revised Competency-Based Medical Education curriculum draw backlash from activists?

description: India's fightback in the second innings of the first Test against New Zealand saw a significant blow when Virat Kohli was dismissed for 70 on the last ball of day three, leaving India at 231/3, trailing by 125 runs. Kohli crossed the 9,000 Test runs milestone.
title: Kohli's last-ball dismissal leaves Rohit in shock

description: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde's son, Shrikant Shinde, sparked controversy by entering the sanctum sanctorum of the Mahakaleshwar temple despite a year-long ban. Opposition Congress criticised the VIP privilege, leading to an investigation ordered by Ujjain's district collector, Neeraj Kumar Singh.
title: Shinde's son enters Ujjain temple's sanctum despite ban, sparks row

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin expressed plans to enhance distribution of Indian films in Russia, acknowledging their popularity and ongoing cultural exchanges. Mentioning cooperation in other sectors like pharmaceuticals, Putin voiced optimism about finding mutual ground with Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi to promote Indian cinema.
title: Putin expresses interest in promoting Indian films in Russia

description: Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy recounted a story of J.R.D. Tata's compassion, highlighting the Tata legacy's deep-rooted values. He praised Ratan Tata’s dedication to community through projects like the Tata Nano. The Infosys co-founder also reflected on Tata's 'compassionate capitalism' and job security for employees during crises, emphasizing valuable leadership lessons.
title: When JRD Tata told Narayana Murthy: “Young man, don't make your wife …”
War of words erupts between Stalin, guv over Hindi month

description: The Enforcement Directorate has attached 35 properties worth Rs 56.56 crore belonging to the Popular Front of India under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act. The investigation reveals PFI's real objectives include creating civil unrest through violent means and providing arms training disguised as Physical Education classes.
title: 'Arms training disguised as PE classes ... goal was civil war': ED gives new details on PFI's activity

description: A 19-year-old woman in Khandwa, Madhya Pradesh, succumbed to injuries after being set on fire by Arjun Balai, whose father she had accused of molestation. Despite Arjun's arrest for attempted murder, he will now face murder charges. The assault occurred on October 12, while the molestation incident happened on October 7, leading to his father's bail on October 8.
title: MP horror: Woman accuses man of molestation, his son sets her ablaze

description: Rishabh Pant sustained a knee injury during India's test against New Zealand, renewing concerns as it affected the same leg he previously had surgery on. Captain Rohit Sharma indicated swelling and tenderness, with experts warning possible severe consequences requiring an extended recovery period if the injury involves ligament damage or joint instability.
title: Rishabh Pant suffers severe injury on the same leg that was operated on

description: Pakistan's Noman Ali and Sajid Khan spin England out to level the series at 1-1, taking all 20 wickets in the second Test at Multan. Noman's 11-wicket haul and Sajid's 9-wicket contribution led to a 152-run victory.
title: 'Pehli dafa akal aayi': Pakistan's win over England delights experts

description: Yahya Sinwar, Hamas leader in Gaza, was killed by Israeli forces on October 17, 2024, in southern Gaza. Sinwar had masterminded last year’s deadly attack on Israel. His death leaves Hamas without a clear leader, creating uncertainty in Gaza’s future. Israeli PM Netanyahu called it a major victory and a crucial step towards ending the war.
title: Yahya Sinwar's death: Is it the 'beginning of the end' for Hamas?

description: Geetha and Latha, alleged to be forcibly confined at Isha Ashram, confirmed to Tamil Nadu police that they are staying voluntarily and in good health. The police report, backed by CCTV footage and witness statements, refutes the father's claims of illegal detention and coercion.
title: No illegal detention in Sadhguru's Isha Ashram, Tamil Nadu police tells SC

description: Footage has captured Hamas chief Yahya Sinwar throwing a stick at an Israeli drone moments before his death in Gaza, ending a year-long manhunt. Israeli infantry forces engaged Sinwar in a firefight, leading to his death in a derelict building. Sinwar's identity was confirmed through dental records and DNA testing, with Hamas yet to officially respond.
title: Video shows Sinwar throwing stick at drone before his death

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will join the 16th BRICS Summit in Russia on October 22-23, 2024, to discuss global political and economic issues. The summit, themed 'Strengthening multilateralism for just global development and security,' includes leaders from the newly expanded BRICS bloc with countries like Egypt, Ethiopia, Iran, and the UAE.
title: PM Modi accepts Putin's invite to attend Brics summit in Russia

description: Former deputy chief minister Tejashwi Yadav criticized Nitish Kumar for the state's failing liquor ban, citing institutional corruption and a flourishing black market. He accused government officials and the police of colluding with the liquor mafia, as the death toll from spurious liquor rises to 33.
title: 'Ban a super flop': Tejashwi slams Nitish after 33 liquor deaths in Bihar

description: The Supreme Court has dismissed a plea for establishing an autonomous body to regulate content on OTT platforms, calling it a policy matter for the executive. The bench emphasized this issue requires extensive stakeholder consultations. The plea highlighted the lack of a regulatory body similar to the Central Board of Film Certification for OTT content.
title: 'We miss out genuine PILs': SC dismisses PIL for regulating OTT content

description: Donald Trump is set to appear on The Undertaker’s podcast, Six Feet Under, as part of his presidential campaign. Trump's engagement in WWE and his relationship with Vince McMahon, along with his enduring impact on wrestling, will likely be topics of discussion.
title: The Undertaker to host former President Trump ahead of US elections

description: Maxime Bernier, leader of the People’s Party of Canada, calls for decisive action if allegations by RCMP and the Liberal government against Indian diplomats are proven true. Bernier questions the credibility of the allegations and suggests Hardeep Singh Nijjar was not a legitimate Canadian citizen, urging improved relations with India instead.
title: Canada opposition leader 'dispels myth', says Nijjar was foreign terrorist

description: The Congress-Samajwadi Party alliance, which won 43 of 80 Lok Sabha seats in Uttar Pradesh, faces tension over seat-sharing for upcoming bypolls. SP has only agreed to spare two seats, Ghaziabad and Khair, for Congress while talks over seat-sharing continue in Maharashtra.
title: After Haryana debacle, has Congress lost its bargaining power in UP bypolls?

description: Elon Musk urges Pennsylvanians to back Donald Trump, stating the election's critical impact on America and Western civilization. At a Philadelphia rally, he adopted Trump's rhetoric on border issues and election security while funding political campaigns with his super PAC. Musk's endorsement highlights a significant shift in his political support.
title: ‘Mad Max’ or ‘Zombie Apocalypse’: Musk on US under Harris

description: China is conducting a large-scale survey across 150 counties to understand public attitudes towards childbirth and address declining birth rates. Officials aim to use the insights for data-driven fertility support policies, promoting marriage and childbirth at appropriate ages, and ensuring shared parenting responsibilities.
title: China launches survey to understand 'fear of having children'

description: In Bihar, the death toll from consuming illicit liquor has risen to 35 across Siwan and Saran districts. The tragedy has sparked political controversy over the effectiveness of the state's liquor ban. Authorities have formed special investigation teams and made arrests while Chief Minister Nitish Kumar urges strict action against those responsible.
title: Bihar hooch tragedy: 10 more die, toll rises to 35

description: World Bank President Ajay Banga commended India's robust growth, highlighting its domestic market-driven momentum despite global challenges. He emphasized improving life quality aspects like air and water. Managing Director Anna Bjerde noted efforts to transform growth into job creation, enhance urban livability, and increase female workforce participation.
title: India's growth rate is among the shiniest parts in the world economy: Ajay Banga

description: The FBI has issued a wanted poster for Vikash Yadav, accused of plotting to assassinate US citizen Gurpatwant Singh Pannun. Yadav allegedly conspired with another Indian national, Nikhil Gupta, utilizing Yadav's position in India's government. The US Justice Department has charged both for murder-for-hire and related conspiracies. Gupta is already extradited and pleaded 'not guilty.'
title: Who is Vikash Yadav, accused by US in Pannun murder plot?

description: Karolina Goswami, a YouTuber living in India, shares a video of herself with security guards after receiving threats from Dhruv Rathee's fans. Despite the attacks, she vows to continue making videos and staying in India. Her video garners over 4 million views.
title: Polish YouTuber Karolina Goswami claims threats from Dhruv Rathee fans

description: The Indian Army's plan to acquire Stryker armoured vehicles from Canada faces uncertainty due to strained India-Canada relations. Despite earlier discussions about co-production with the US and General Dynamics Land Systems Canada, no significant progress has been made.
title: Indian Army’s plan to buy Ontario-produced Stryker armoured vehicles hits snag

description: Donald Trump and Melania made a rare public appearance at the Al Smith charity dinner. Trump jabbed at Kamala Harris, who was notably absent, opting to campaign in Wisconsin. Melania's memoir promoting abortion rights creates additional buzz.
title: Melania, Donald Trump make rare public outing together at Al Smith dinner

description: After Rishabh Pant was forced off the field a day earlier due to a knee injury while wicketkeeping, Yashasvi Jaiswal also sustained a thumb injury on Friday while fielding at gully but returned to play with a taped thumb.
title: After Pant, Jaiswal faces injury scare in Bengaluru Test

description: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde asserts confidence in the Mahayuti coalition securing a decisive victory in the upcoming state assembly elections. He cites BJP's success in Haryana and emphasizes welfare schemes like the Ladki Bahin Yojana, while facing opposition from the Maha Vikas Aghadi.
title: Haryana results will be replicated in Maharashtra: Eknath Shinde

description: The death of notorious forest brigand Veerappan brought infrastructural improvements and reduced police brutality in Tamil Nadu and Karnataka tribal areas. However, issues like displacement, unregulated resorts, and inadequate tribal rights persist. Activists call for dedicated departments and better education to prevent new insurgencies.
title: 20 years after Veerappan: A Tamil Nadu forest tries to heal

description: The Supreme Court has issued guidelines for implementing the Prohibition of Child Marriage Act (PCMA), 2006, and declared it will override all personal laws. The court emphasized the need for community-driven approaches, multi-sectoral coordination, and penalising offenders as a last resort.
title: Prohibition of Child Marriage Act can't be stunted by personal laws: SC

description: AWS CEO Matt Garman has told employees to adapt to a five-day office week or leave, emphasizing that in-person collaboration is vital for innovation. While some support the policy, others argue it undermines remote work's benefits. Critics question the superiority of in-office work over remote productivity.
title: Amazon cloud services boss has this 'strong message'

description: Dengue cases are escalating swiftly, necessitating urgent preventive measures. Identifying the disease-spreading Aedes mosquitos, known for their black and white stripes and daytime biting habits, is crucial. These mosquitoes breed in stagnant water, emphasizing the importance of eliminating breeding sites and using repellents. Protective clothing and treated bed nets are also recommended to reduce exposure.
title: Dengue prevention tips: How to identify dengue mosquito

description: Nokia, aiming to reduce costs amid challenging telecom market conditions, lays off 2,000 employees in Greater China and plans to cut 350 jobs in Europe. The cuts are part of a broader strategy to save up to 1.2 billion euros by 2026.
title: Nokia is cutting 2,000 jobs in China

description: After Baba Siddique's assassination, Salman Khan has now got a fresh death threat where he has been asked to give Rs 5 crore if he wants to be alive and end the enmity with Lawrence Bishnoi. Or else, his condition will be worse than Siddique.
title: Salman Khan gets a fresh death threat

description: Delhi's air quality has significantly worsened, with AQI levels hitting 'very poor' in several areas and toxic foam in the Yamuna adding to the problem. The Delhi government is enforcing GRAP-1 measures, deploying anti-smog guns, and urging residents to take precautions to reduce pollution.
title: Scary visuals: Delhi faces dual challenge of bad air and toxic Yamuna froth

description: Ranveer Raghuvanshi lost his chance at Rs 1,60,000 on Kaun Banega Crorepati 16, taking home Rs 10,000. Dr. Neeraj Saxena then gracefully quit the game at Rs 3,20,000 to give younger contestants a chance. This unprecedented gesture earned him applause from host Amitabh Bachchan and the audience.
title: Kaun Banega Crorepati 16: Contestant Dr. Neeraj Saxena quits

description: Infosys reported adding 2,456 employees in Q2 FY25, ending a six-quarter hiring decline, with a total headcount of 3,17,788.
title: Infosys reverses this 'employee trend' after 6 quarters

description: Ajay Bhutoria, a National Finance Committee member for Kamala Harris, launched a Bollywood-inspired video to rally South Asian voters in key battleground states. The video emphasizes unity and contrasts Harris's hopeful vision against Trump's divisiveness, aiming to boost voter turnout with messages in multiple South Asian languages.
title: Watch: Indian-Americans roll out Bollywood-inspired video to support Kamala Harris

description: Mumbai Traffic Police have received a threatening WhatsApp message demanding Rs 5 crore from Salman Khan to resolve a feud with Lawrence Bishnoi. The message warns that Khan's fate could be worse than Baba Siddique's if he doesn’t comply. Authorities have registered the case and launched an investigation to verify its authenticity.
title: Salman Khan gets 'death threat' again; Rs 5cr sought to settle feud with Bishnoi

description: Music fans are mourning the loss of former One Direction member Liam Payne, who died at 31 after falling from a hotel balcony in Argentina. Payne rose to fame through The X Factor and was part of the globally successful band One Direction. The group split in 2016, but Payne enjoyed a solo career until his untimely death.
title: Look back at Liam Payne's X Factor audition at 14 that led to his 'dream' career

description: The US has charged former Indian RAW officer Vikash Yadav for allegedly plotting to assassinate a Sikh separatist in New York City. Yadav is accused of orchestrating the plot remotely and recruiting a hitman with a $15,000 payment. India informed the US that Yadav has been removed from government service.
title: US charges ex-Indian intelligence officer over plot to kill Sikh separatist

description: A Reddit poll from 'Startup India' has named Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu as the best Indian startup founder, praised for job creation and strong business practices. Byju Raveendran of Byju's was voted the worst, facing criticism for toxic work culture, misleading practices, and financial mismanagement.
title: Reddit's community names 'Best' & 'Worst' startup founders

description: Pakistan have set a challenging target of 297 runs for England to win the second Test in Multan. A crucial 65-run partnership between Agha Salman and Sajid Khan helped Pakistan recover to post 221 in their second innings. England, trailing by 261 runs, had lost two wickets by the third day's close.
title: 'Tere bhai ne, Lara wala': Hilarious banter caught on stump mic

description: The number of taxpayers in India increased by 82% from 2014-15 to 2023-24, and direct tax receipts surged 182%, largely due to better compliance and the use of technology. Personal income tax collections rose significantly, surpassing corporate tax collections for the second consecutive year.
title: Number of taxpayers rises 82% to 10.4cr in last 9 yrs: CBDT

description: Pakistan's recent struggles in Test cricket and early exits from ODI and T20 World Cups have raised concerns about the Pakistan Cricket Board's management. A major shake-up in the selection committee, led by Aaqib Javed, aims to address performance issues. Even India coach Gautam Gambhir has expressed worry over Pakistan's decline, affecting the excitement of India-Pakistan matches.
title: 'Aaqib bhai, Pakistan ko kya ho gaya?' Gambhir asked - Watch

description: Israeli forces have killed Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar, a key figure in the 7 October attack on Israel. Found in Gaza rubble, his identity was confirmed through DNA and other records. Israel sees this as a major victory, while Hamas has yet to confirm the death.
title: Watch: Hamas chief Sinwar's last moments before being killed by Israel

description: Bangladesh's International Crimes Tribunal issued arrest warrants for former PM Sheikh Hasina and 45 others for alleged crimes against humanity during the deadly student-led uprising. Notable figures include Awami League's Obaidul Quader, writer Zafar Iqbal, and former judge AHM Shamsuddin Chowdhury Manik.
title: Bangladesh tribunal issues arrest warrants against Hasina

description: Nayab Singh Saini was sworn in as Haryana CM for the second time at a ceremony attended by top political leaders, including PM Narendra Modi. The new cabinet consists of 11 cabinet ministers and two ministers of state, representing diverse communities. Portfolios will be allotted on Friday.
title: Granddaughters of 2 Haryana former CMs in Saini’s team

description: Supreme Court declares all Bangladeshi migrants who entered Assam post-March 25, 1971, illegal. A five-judge bench validates Section 6A of the Citizenship Act, urging the Union and state governments to accelerate the identification, detection, and deportation processes of these migrants, citing cultural and demographic impacts.
title: Bangladeshis entering Assam after March 24, 1971 are illegal immigrants, says SC

description: Former Pakistan PM Nawaz Sharif expressed optimism about Foreign Minister Jaishankar's visit for the SCO meeting, reminiscing about Narendra Modi's visit in 2015. Sharif criticized Imran Khan for damaging Indo-Pak relations and emphasized moving forward without being hindered by past grievances.
title: ‘Time to bury the past’: Nawaz outreach to PM Modi

description: Anant Ambani threw an extravagant birthday party for his wife, Radhika Merchant, on October 16, celebrating in style with a host of Bollywood celebrities in Mumbai. The grand celebration was a star-studded affair attended by stars such as Ananya Panday, Suhana Khan, Janhvi Kapoor, and Khushi Kapoor alongside friends and family. The guest list included other prominent personalities like Aryan Khan, Arjun Kapoor, Ranveer Singh, and cricket legend MS Dhoni.
title: Radhika Merchant's b'day bash: MS Dhoni, Ranveer Singh have a gala time with Ambanis

description: Byju's founder Byju Raveendran addressed various issues, including major setbacks, investor exits, and disputes, revealing that Byju's current worth is zero. He plans to repay the company's outstanding debts but faces challenges due to aggressive lender tactics. Despite hurdles, he remains committed to teaching and has future plans to return to India.
title: Byjus is now worth zero, but no one can stop me..., says founder

description: Saumitra Biswas's younger brother has called for a reinvestigation into the 2001 death of his brother, a fourth-year MBBS student at R G Kar Medical College in Kolkata. He claims that the case was mislabeled as a suicide to protect politically connected individuals and links it to a more recent tragedy at the same institution.
title: Victim's brother demands fresh probe into 2001 RG Kar death

description: India's Supreme Court upheld Section 6A of the Citizenship Act, granting citizenship to Bangladeshi migrants who entered India before March 25, 1971. CJI D Y Chandrachud deemed the cut-off date reasonable, linked to the Pakistan army's operation in East Pakistan. Despite high migration impacts, the ruling emphasizes Assam's unique cultural and political challenges.
title: Application of 6A only to Assam tied to impact of influx, says CJI
